intro: Hippeastrum striatifolium, commonly known as the Zebra lily, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, striped leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces large, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, typically in the spring or early summer. It is a bulbous plant that thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate watering. Hippeastrum striatifolium is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
